verses.text: Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.
\add O my soul\add*, thou hast said unto the \sc Lord\sc*, Thou \add art\add* my Lord: My goodness \add extendeth\add* not to thee;
\add But\add* to the saints that \add are\add* in the earth, And \add to\add* the excellent, in whom \add is\add* all my delight.
Their sorrows shall be multiplied \add that\add* hasten \add after\add* another \add god:\add* Their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, Nor take up their names into my lips.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: Thou maintainest my lot.
The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant \add places;\add* Yea, I have a goodly heritage.
I will bless the \sc Lord\sc*, who hath given me counsel: My reins also instruct me \add in\add* the night seasons.
I have set the \sc Lord\sc* always before me: Because \add he is\add* at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: My flesh also shall rest in hope.
For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; Neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
Thou wilt shew me the path of life: In thy presence \add is\add* fulness of joy; At thy right hand \add there are\add* pleasures for evermore.
